No matching HTML element exists, so data-wb (Web Behaviors) attribute is required:
Simply add data-wb="behavior-name" to any HTML element. No initialization code required!

docs/Auto-Injection.md.text: **Auto Injection (Preview)** is a core feature of Web Behaviors (WB) that automatically enhances standard HTML5 semantic elements with rich functionality. Instead of manually adding `data-wb` attribut
If you want to **prevent** Auto Injection for a specific element, you must use the `data-wb-ignore` attribute.
If you want to use a semantic element *without* the WB behavior, add the `data-wb-ignore` attribute.

docs/pricecard.md.text: The original implementation of the Web Behavior (WB) system relied heavily on `div` elements with `data-wb` attributes (e.g., `<div data-wb="cardpricing">`). While functional, this approach led to:
We implemented a "Pseudo-Custom Element" (PCE) system that maps specific HTML tags to WB behaviors without requiring the `data-wb` attribute.

docs/standards/V3-STANDARDS.md.text: WB v3.0 uses **custom elements** (`<wb-*>`) instead of the legacy `data-wb` attribute pattern.

docs/WB_BEHAVIOR_SYSTEM.md.text: Or use `data-wb` for explicit behavior injection (Legacy/Override):
Finds and processes all elements with `data-wb` AND auto-injects behaviors on semantic tags (if enabled):
// 1. Find all elements with data-wb attribute
// Skip if data-wb is present (already handled) or ignored
// Check if node itself has data-wb

The Auto-Injection system allows standard HTML5 semantic elements to automatically receive behaviors without explicit `data-wb` attributes. This feature was introduced to reduce markup verbosity and p
1.  **Cleaner Markup**: Removes the need to add `data-wb="card"` or `data-wb="navbar"` to every element. Your HTML looks like standard HTML.
3.  **Precedence**: Explicit `data-wb` attributes **always** take precedence. If an element has `data-wb` (even empty), auto-injection is skipped.
4.  **Opt-Out**: You can prevent auto-injection on a specific element by adding `data-wb-ignore` or an empty `data-wb=""`.
2. **Progressive Enhancement** - Start with semantic HTML, enhance with `data-wb`

The original implementation of the Web Behavior (WB) system relied heavily on `div` elements with `data-wb` attributes (e.g., `<div data-wb="cardpricing">`). While functional, this approach led to:
We implemented a "Pseudo-Custom Element" (PCE) system that maps specific HTML tags to WB behaviors without requiring the `data-wb` attribute.
WB v3.0 uses **custom elements** (`<wb-*>`) instead of the legacy `data-wb` attribute pattern.
Or use `data-wb` for explicit behavior injection (Legacy/Override):

The Auto-Injection system allows standard HTML5 semantic elements to automatically receive behaviors without explicit `data-wb` attributes. This feature was introduced to reduce markup verbosity and p
1.  **Cleaner Markup**: Removes the need to add `data-wb="card"` or `data-wb="navbar"` to every element. Your HTML looks like standard HTML.
3.  **Precedence**: Explicit `data-wb` attributes **always** take precedence. If an element has `data-wb` (even empty), auto-injection is skipped.
4.  **Opt-Out**: You can prevent auto-injection on a specific element by adding `data-wb-ignore` or an empty `data-wb=""`.
2. **Progressive Enhancement** - Start with semantic HTML, enhance with `data-wb`
